page.title: 06Upsettlington village
page.content: The hamlet of Upsettlington is part of the Ladykirk Estate. It comprises Ladykirk house, the Home farm, Waltersteads farm and cottages. After the 1st. World War the present owners father started a large rebuilding program, primarily to give employment to ex-service men- for instance 20 men bicycled from Norham daily, in addition to men on the estate and in all 120 cottages were renovated and in some cases rebuilt including Ladykirk village itself. In 1937 the owner paid a large amount to bring electricity to the estate from Coldstream. After the 2nd. World War Major Askew _the current owner_ continued the renovation work. Again ex-service men were employed and bathrooms and lavatories were installed in all the cottages. The old Ladykirk house (built 1790) was then rebuilt.
